poem:
**Rally Under a Grey Sky**  

The FTSE dances,  
a nimble 5.7% waltz,  
while takeover whispers  
weave between the tea leaves,  
London blinking amid the tick and tock.  
In boardrooms, defenses gather dust,  
lines drawn but unseen,  
as the market murmurs resilience,  
a capital concerto under  
a resolute, though muted, sky.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "FTSE 100 rallies by 5.7% in 2024 in ‘a year of resilience’ for the stock market – business live 3.44pm GMT There could be a flurry of takeover action in London next year too. UK investment bank Peel Hunt has predicted that 2025 will bring a major and sustained flow of UK takeovers. Peel Hunt’s head of M&A advisory, Michael Nicholson, says: “Bid defence manuals are no longer an item to be left on the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
